intro: Podocarpus vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis podocarp, is a species of conifer native to the islands of Vanuatu and Fiji. It is a medium-sized evergreen tree that can reach heights of up to 20 meters. The plant has scale-like leaves that are arranged in decussate pairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its cones are small and woody, containing edible seeds that are dispersed by wind. Podocarpus vitiensis plays an important role in the tropical forest ecosystems of the South Pacific, providing habitat and contributing to biodiversity.
